channel.title: InputQuery
channel.description: How do I check if the Input string is not an integer? I need this for my quadratic equation solver. I've tried searching for help on Pascal but there are a few results. Thanks in advance. :)

item.title: InputQuery
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

If IsNumeric(string) = TRUE then
begin
//bullshit
end
else
begin
writeln('Invalid input);
end

Read full topic

item.title: InputQuery
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:1, topic:364240”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=460455.msg3368756#msg3368756 date=1287025127]
You could try to convert the string to an integer and if there is an error then it isn’t an integer.
[/quote]

... ... InputQuery('aX^2 + bX + c = 0', 'Fill in the value of c:', Input); c := StrToInt(Input); Writeln('c is '+Input+'.'); ... ...

I’ve done that but I still can insert alphabets into the box.[/quote]

I may be wrong but it looks to me as you are printing the input string not the integer ‘c’

Read full topic

item.title: InputQuery
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Still does not work. ???

Compiled succesfully in 31 ms. Value: 345fd False Value: dc False Value: 33 True Successfully executed.
Are you sure about that?

Read full topic

item.title: InputQuery
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Needs to be StrToFloat

function IsNumeric(s:String): Boolean; var e: Extended; begin Result := True; try e := StrToFloat(s) except Result := False; end; end;

Read full topic

item.title: InputQuery
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You could try to convert the string to an integer and if there is an error then it isn’t an integer.

Read full topic
